issues.title: Root path in the preference manager won't update when workspace folder changes

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Update the root path on workspace folder change event (#1389)

fixes #1388

Signed-off-by: Sheng Chen <sheche@microsoft.com>

issues.body:
The `updateWorkspaceFolders` in https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/managers/ProjectsManager.java#L160

will not update the `rootPaths` in `preferenceManager`, which will cause some unexpected behavior when using `rootPaths`. for example, here:
https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/DocumentLifeCycleHandler.java#L309

Suppose we opened a multi-root workspace in VS Code. Then we added a new folder into the workspace, and the added folder contains an invisible project.

Because there is no trigger files information, the Invisible project importer won't work, and if we open its java source file, the Language server will open it as a default project file.

But if we correct the rootPaths field, the `InvisibleProjectImporter` will be triggered to import it.

- Open an existing file and save the file under a different filename.
- Open the newly created file. This triggers a BadLocationException and the client receives diagnostics with negative line numbers in the range.


(I'm using the LSP support being added to neovim - currently only available in master)

issues.title: Inconsistent filterText and textEdit are returned, violating the LSP spec
eclipse.jdt.ls build fails due to breaking changes in LSP4J
issues.body:
See https://ci.eclipse.org/ls/job/jdt-ls-master/807/console

The error is caused by changes in [lsp4j API](https://github.com/eclipse/lsp4j/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v090-tbd):  
* Parameter of `textDocument/signatureHelp` changed from `TextDocumentPositionParams position` to `SignatureHelpParams params`

issues.title: textDocument/signatureHelp broken if previous string parameter has ( or {
issues.body:
``` java
foo ("(", |);
```

The textDocument/signatureHelp returns empty signature with cursor on `|`.

issues.title: Incorrect signatures returned assertEquals
Add the location check back when loading bundles
issues.body:
In #1253, I removed the location check when loading bundle, which means when loading bundles, if there is already a bundle with the same version installed/started, all the bundles with the same version will be ignored.

This is fine for the common users, but it may have some problems for the developers who develop Java LS extensions.

For example, when launching the extension in dev mode for the Java Debugger or Java Test Runner, since the bundles have no qualifier in version, so the developing bundles won't be loaded unless bump-up the version, or clean the LS cache, which is not convenient.

I think I should add the location check back.

issues.title: BasicFileDetectorTest.testInclusions* fail randomly
issues.body: See https://ci.eclipse.org/ls/job/jdt-ls-master/744/testReport/

issues.title: Build job reported the errors from unrelated gradle projects outside my workspace
issues.body:
Reproduce steps:
1. Use the launch file **jdt.ls.socket-stream.launch** to launch eclipse.jdt.ls process first.
2. Use **vscode-java/Launch Extension - JDTLS Client** to attach a VS Code client. And in the launched VS Code client, it opens a gradle project [fx2048](https://github.com/brunoborges/fx2048).
3. Repeat step1 and 2, but in the step 2, open a new gradle project [leakcanary](https://github.com/open-android/LeakCanaryDemo/tree/master/leakcanary). 

In the PROBLEMS view, you can see previous fx2048 project errors displayed in my new workspace leakcanary.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14052197/68574179-4bbc4a00-04a4-11ea-826c-742d29d2124c.png)

This may be one reason for the famous Build failed issue https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/495.

issues.title: Hover links to Java artifact from JARs don't work in VSCode
issues.body:
This is with version 0.52.0 of JDT LS
Install Red Hat Java extension in VSCode.

Consider the following project:
[spring-petclinic.zip](https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/files/3768696/spring-petclinic.zip)

Extract it and open it in VSCode.
Open class: `PetRepository`
Hover over `Repository` (line 34: `PetRepository extends Repository<Pet, Integer>`)
Find `CrudRepository` on the hover.
Click the hyperlink `CrudRepository` from the hover.
Opened `CrudRepository.class` editor is empty

However, if you just open CrudRepository from the `Workspace Symbol` UI it opens up fine.

Something is wrong in the doc URI for the hover

Looks like `%5C` is missing. See two attached files with correct and wrong URI (from hover) split up with new lines - compare these 2 files:

issues.title: Maven import failure caused by m2e-apt unable to parse maven-compiler-plugin configuration
issues.body:
When importing a multi-module maven project on vscode, it fails with this error message: 
```The project was not built since its build path is incomplete. Cannot find the class file for java.lang.Object. Fix the build path then try building this project```
Running `mvn clean install` on cli returns no error and IntelliJ has no issues. I've also reported a bug here, as I use emacs: https://github.com/emacs-lsp/lsp-java/issues/167
Also, this could be related: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=496130

issues.title: Test failures
issues.body: The build started failing because of a change in behavior of JDT

issues.title: Type filter blocks filtered type's code completion
issues.body:
Related reddit thread: [Java and intellisense issue with JPanel?](https://www.reddit.com/r/vscode/comments/dc5uvb/java_and_intellisense_issue_with_jpanel/)

The types specified in preference `java.completion.filteredTypes` would not get any completion suggession even if we are already using instances of them, as follows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20227484/66888950-193d3f80-f013-11e9-9904-735ea6a14771.png)

(All methods of `java.awt.Graphics2D` have been hidden, leaving only methods of `Object` class)

I think removing filtered types from import suggessions is acceptable, but we should at least provide code completions when user is indeed using instances of `java.awt` classes, since many of the java beginners (e.g. university students) will learn to write GUI with them.

issues.title: Workspace symbols may have records without name.

This is an issue I noticed when having reactor classes on a classpath. Specifically when requesting workspace symbols and filtering by `Mono`, result set in vscode in empty. In my case there's 268 symbols returned for a query.

vscode shows this error in an extension host log:
```
[2019-10-09 15:02:52.826] [exthost] [error] [redhat.java] provider FAILED
[2019-10-09 15:02:52.826] [exthost] [error] Error: name must not be falsy
	at Function.validate (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/services/extensions/node/extensionHostProcess.js:361:366)
	at new b (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/services/extensions/node/extensionHostProcess.js:361:315)
	at new b (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/services/extensions/node/extensionHostProcess.js:350:44)
	at C (/home/jvalkealahti/.vscode/extensions/redhat.java-0.50.0/dist/extension.js:1:548818)
	at module.exports.t.createConverter.asSymbolInformations.e.map.e (/home/jvalkealahti/.vscode/extensions/redhat.java-0.50.0/dist/extension.js:1:553120)
	at Array.map (<anonymous>)
	at asSymbolInformations (/home/jvalkealahti/.vscode/extensions/redhat.java-0.50.0/dist/extension.js:1:553113)
	at i (/home/jvalkealahti/.vscode/extensions/vscjava.vscode-java-test-0.20.0/dist/extension.js:16:188376)
	at /home/jvalkealahti/.vscode/extensions/vscjava.vscode-java-test-0.20.0/dist/extension.js:16:188870
```

When looking trace log, one of these symbols don't have a name, vscode errors and doesn't show anything.
```
[Trace - 14:11:33] Sending request 'workspace/symbol - (6091)'.
Params: {
    "query": "Mono"
}


[Trace - 14:11:33] Received response 'workspace/symbol - (6091)' in 64ms.
Result: [
    ...
    {
        "name": "",
        "kind": 5,
        "location": {
            "uri": "jdt://contents/reactor-core-3.3.0.RC1.jar/reactor.core.publisher/MonoExtensionsKt$sam$java_util_function_Supplier$0.class?=spring-cloud-dataflow-language-server/%5C/home%5C/jvalkealahti%5C/.m2%5C/repository%5C/io%5C/projectreactor%5C/reactor-core%5C/3.3.0.RC1%5C/reactor-core-3.3.0.RC1.jar=/gradle_used_by_scope=/main,test=/%3Creactor.core.publisher(MonoExtensionsKt$sam$java_util_function_Supplier$0.class",
            "range": {
                "start": {
                    "line": 0,
                    "character": 0
                },
                "end": {
                    "line": 0,
                    "character": 0
                }
            }
        },
        "containerName": "reactor.core.publisher"
    },
    ...
]
```
I think jdt server should make sure that if name cannot be calculated, it's not added to a returned symbols.

If there is an error on a specific line of code which you don't fix but meanwhile you make changes to the code that would produce another error on the same line, the second error is not reported until you fix the first one. Here's a quick illustration:

![2019-08-12_14-10-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1178309/62861127-1cfad000-bd0b-11e9-8960-25a4dc9c0f92.gif)

issues.title: The project's package fragments are not update to date when adding a new one.
issues.body:
## Repro steps:
- Open a java project to let the Java Language Server start up
- Create a new folder, the folder path is belong to one of the project's PackageFragmentRoot
- Create a Java file in that folder
- Then, when we get a IJavaProject instance in the Java side, and inspect the PackageFragment, there is no entry for the new created one. (You can call `project.getPackageFragmentRoots()` first, after find the right root, call `getChildren()` over it)

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6193897/66696799-acb7fd00-ed01-11e9-8234-b83c78e75ea7.gif)

This bug affects several scenario, like:
- Cannot move a compilation unit to a newly created package (gif above)
- Could not find or load main class xxx when debugging a main class in newly created package
- Java dependency viewer cannot show the newly created package and its members in the explorer
- Java Test explorer cannot show the newly created package and its members in the explorer

issues.title: org.eclipse.jdt.ui is included into org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core
issues.body:
> org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF:
Import-Package: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.codemanipulation

This is a regression from https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/commit/9ae4568297a3739a40775a23d8ce4d403c7ce49c. Because this package also existed in org.eclipse.jdt.ui, reloading target platform will cause jdt.ui included into jdt.ls.core plugin dependencies.

issues.title: Disabling the gradle wrapper doesn't work in some cases
issues.body:
If the gradle wrapper is disabled and no gradle home variable is defined, the GradleProjectImporter.getGradleDistribution returns the wrapper anyways, instead of the default gradle distro (DEFAULT_DISTRIBUTION == GradleDistribution.fromBuild() == wrapper):
https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/43a78f7c339f41d7cb3c4d6d23e3fe18b74c29ef/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/managers/GradleProjectImporter.java#L120-L124.

And if the GradleProjectImporterTest.testDisableGradleWrapper runs in an environment which defines a gradle home, then the test fails L109:

https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/43a78f7c339f41d7cb3c4d6d23e3fe18b74c29ef/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.tests/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/managers/GradleProjectImporterTest.java#L107-L109

issues.title: Signature help doesn't match active parameter per type
issues.body: eg. when calling the signature help on `foo`, in  `new RuntimeException("foo")`, the active signature returned is  `RuntimeException(Throwable)`, instead of `RuntimeException(String)`

issues.title: Signature help does not work for constructors
issues.body:
E. g. 
```
new RuntimeException(|);
```

issues.title: Signature Help doesn't correctly detect the active signature
issues.body: When calling the signatureHelp feature on an existing method call (`Trigger Parameter hint` command in vscode), the wrong signature is selected initially. Here the cursor is on "a": Currently, the server returns the 1st method that has a matching parameter at the cursor position. Instead, it should identify the current method from the offset, then match signatures that match that invocation.

Use proper symbols for interfaces, enums, enum values and constants

One noticeable change is that, for methods, we no longer return
CompletionItemKind.Function but CompletionItemKind.Method instead.

Fixes #1012

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

If the return type is a generic type and the user peek the implementation of it, an exception could be observed in the output channel.

![issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6193897/56489339-02120f00-6514-11e9-936e-64cef3199324.gif)

This is not a big problem, but it could be better if the Language Server could handle the exception instead of throwing it to the client side.

issues.title: NavigateToDefinitionHandler doesn't check null which will cause NullPointerException
issues.body:
This issue is related to: https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/pull/879
https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/ca81aa7b935b52c0aff7624fa9f330c832578233/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/NavigateToDefinitionHandler.java#L79
The `location` here may be `null`, and if it is, a `NullPointerException` will be thrown which isn't caught as well.


The interesting thing is that when I goto definition on `java.lang.string` in macOS, this exception doesn't occur while it occurs on Linux. Not sure if it has anything to do with the `if `logic above.


Following is the stack trace(caught):
```
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core.internal.handlers.NavigateToDefinitionHandler.fixLocation(NavigateToDefinitionHandler.java:79)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core.internal.handlers.NavigateToDefinitionHandler.computeDefinitionNavigation(NavigateToDefinitionHandler.java:62)
        at org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core.internal.handlers.NavigateToDefinitionHandler.definition(NavigateToDefinitionHandler.java:45)
...
```

issues.title: [regression] "Add parentheses around cast" doesn't work as expected
Bulk accessor generation should ignore static fields
Quickfix for private unused field disappear
issues.body:
Looks like the PR https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/pull/895 `Don't send empty code actions` skipped the quickfix proposal `Create getter and setter` for private unused field. 

The corresponding change is put in WorkspaceEdit#documentChanges instead of #changes so ChangeUtil#hasChanges skips it.

issues.title: [regression] diagnostics no longer reported on startup, for existing projects

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Publish diagnostics of non-working copies on restart. Fixes #874

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body: When you reopen an existing workspace, diagnostics are no longer reported. The regression is caused by c9c5b0a0

issues.title: BasicFileDetectorTest tests fail randomly
issues.body:
Several tests (ReorgQuickFixTest, PrepareRenameHandler, RenameHandlerTest) set  JavaLanguageServerPlugin.preferenceManager incorrectly which is the reason for BasicFileDetectorTest tests to fail.
See https://ci.eclipse.org/ls/job/jdt-ls-pr/1159/

You can reproduce the issue by calling the following command more times:

```
mvn -Dtest=ReorgQuickFixTest,BasicFileDetectorTest clean verify 
```

issues.title: Closing a file doesn't reset diagnostics of dirty changes
issues.body:
- open a Java file in a project
- break something without saving
- compilation errors are reported
- close file without saving
- diagnostics are not reset

Only reopening the file will reset the diagnostics

issues.title: Completion cache resets after file recompilation resulting in slow code completion
issues.body:
I have large enough project (about 8000 java files). Code completion works fast if you do not edit a file, but if you do some edits you will wait for any kind of suggestion for several seconds. Typing code becomes a headache. 

STR:
1. Open large project and one java file
2. Try to edit some lines of code : cut and paste, request autocompletion. It should be fast
3. Open any ten files in the same project, don't touch them, just open
4. Repeat step 2, performance will get terribly slow.

Screencast:
![peek 2018-11-14 14-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7345761/48480461-95377200-e81b-11e8-8211-f878dcf14ac7.gif)

issues.title: Create getter/setter code action is not available in some cases.
JDT changes the project after calling codeSelect of CompilationUnit
issues.body:
JDTUtils.findElementAtSelection will call [codeSelect](https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/48c9fe231414b110e07ab4b4f957d4f45e18352d/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/JDTUtils.java#L615) which will lost the original project information for JDK classes like java.lang.String, sees it is related to the SelectionEngine in JDT(eclispse has the same issue too), because of this issue, the java dependency viewer will not link the tree node for SDK classes since the default project is not displayed in tree explorer(when opening a folder containing multiple projects)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17075863/48322579-45ae4600-e663-11e8-90b0-f4abdddec9bb.png)

issues.title: 'Force Java compilation' breaks diagnostics in dirty files
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:

- open a Java project
- ensure that there is no diagnostic message
- edit a Java file so you get a diagnostic message
- do not save the file
- call 'Force Java compilation'>Full

Diagnostic message disappears.

A solution would be to:

- require a user to save all dirty files when calling 'Force Java compilation'
or
- revalidate opened compilation units after building the workspace

issues.title: [releng] Unable to locate installable unit from the target platform: Eclipse Plug-ins for Gradle
issues.body:
I cannot load the `Buildship: Eclipse Plug-ins for Gradle - 2.2.2.v20180918-2317-s` dependency from the http://download.eclipse.org/buildship/updates/e47/snapshots/2.x/ p2 update site. Instead of the desired dependency, I can get `Buildship: Eclipse Plug-ins for Gradle - 2.2.2.v20181001-2320-s`.

Does anyone else have the same issue? Thanks!

issues.title: [regression] project level errors don't disappear
issues.body:
After changing a pom.xml plugin configuration (eg. java source level), the `Project configuration is not up-to-date with pom.xml, requires an update.` shows up. After triggering the update configuration command, the warning is not removed. 
Same thing for wrong project natures in .project.
Works fine in previous release

issues.title: "Force Java Compilation" command fails if there are "Project configuration is not up-to-date with pom.xml" errors
issues.body: When a project has the " Project configuration is not up-to-date with pom.xml. Select: Maven->Update Project... from the project context menu or use Quick Fix"  warning, executing the `java/buildWorkspace` command fails because the warning is considered an error.

issues.title: Completion proposals for snippets should not be included if the client does not declare support for snippets
issues.body:
snippet completions are an optional feature (requiring `capabilities.completion.completionItem.snippetSupport = true`.

However, snippet proposals are still included even when that is false.

ycmd chokes on this meaning that no completions are provided.

* i am sending "capabilities": {}
* and receiving: "insertTextFormat": 2, for certain completions, such as:

```
2018-06-11 23:59:51,627 - DEBUG - RX: Received message: b'{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":"13","result":{"label":"class","kind":15,"documentation":"/**\\n * InnerTestLauncher\\n */\\npublic class InnerTestLauncher {\\n\\n\\t\\n}","sortText":"999999998","filterText":"class","insertText":"/**\\n * InnerTestLauncher\\n */\\npublic class InnerTestLauncher {\\n\\n\\t\\n}","insertTextFormat":2}}'
```

issues.title: interface/class snippets should not be available inside method bodies
issues.body: Currently, class and interface snippets are available inside method bodies, they should not. There are probably other places where you don't want to see those snippets. It all depends on the context.

issues.title: No completion documentation for source methods with parameters
issues.body:
When invoking completion for a method defined in the same class, the completion UI never shows documentation when the method has a parameter (or more). The same thing works for methods without parameters.
This can be reoproduced with both Che and VSCode

issues.title: Problems with project initialization
issues.body:
While debugging Selenium tests for Che, I have come across two problems when initializing the workspace.
1. When a project exist already in the workspace with linked content, does not have the Maven nature and a name different from the maven id of the project, the import fails with an exception. However, when the name is the same as the maven id, the import fails silently.
2. ProjectsManager#updateWorkspace() does not lock any resources in the workspace. This means it can run in parallel with ProjectsManager#initializeProjects(). This leads to exceptions due to concurrency errors.

Framework Documentation** For a tutorial and programming guide with examples of use of the collections framework, please see: * [ **Collections Framework Tutorial**](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/collections/index.html) Since: 1.0 * | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | Interface | Description | | Collection | The root interface in the *collection hierarchy*. | | Comparator | A comparison function, which imposes a *total ordering* on some collection of objects. | | Deque | A linear collection that supports element insertion and removal at both ends. | | Enumeration | An object that implements the Enumeration interface generates a series of elements, one at a time. | | EventListener | A tagging interface that all event listener interfaces must extend. | | Formattable | The `Formattable` interface must be implemented by any class that needs to perform custom formatting using the `'s'` conversion specifier of `Formatter`. | | Iterator | An iterator over a collection. | | List | An ordered collection (also known as a *sequence*). | | ListIterator | An iterator for lists that allows the programmer to traverse the list in either direction, modify the list during iteration, and obtain the iterator's current position in the list. | | Map | An object that maps keys to values. | | Map.Entry | A map entry (key-value pair). | | NavigableMap | A `SortedMap` extended with navigation methods returning the closest matches for given search targets. | | NavigableSet | A `SortedSet` extended with navigation methods reporting closest matches for given search targets. | | Observer | Deprecated. PrimitiveIterator.OfInt | An Iterator specialized for `int` values. | | PrimitiveIterator.OfLong | An Iterator specialized for `long` values. | | Queue | A collection designed for holding elements prior to processing. | | RandomAccess | Marker interface used by `List` implementations to indicate that they support fast (generally constant time) random access. | | ServiceLoader.Provider | Represents a service provider located by `ServiceLoader`. | | Set | A collection that contains no duplicate elements. | | SortedMap | A `Map` that further provides a *total ordering* on its keys. | | issues.title: server is not initialized correctly without configuration call

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Move dynamic registration to initialized

Moves the dynamic registration of the server capabilities
to initialized notification

fixes #601

Signed-off-by: Gorkem Ercan <gorkem.ercan@gmail.com>

issues.body: Server is not intialized correctly if the client does not send `didChangeConfiguration`. It is possible that a client does not support settings. Also LSP does not really define an order for the `didChangeConfiguration` notification.  Instead of depending on `didChangeConfigration` we should use the `initialized` notification.

issues.title: Workspace symbols URI is not returning the correct URI
issues.body: The workspace URI that is currently being returned is "file:/....." whereas the file URI should be something like "file:///".

issues.title: Cached decompiled content served indefinitely even though source is available
issues.body:
See https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/447

Basically if the source file was not attached at some point and the decompiled content was served, even after the source is attached, the cached decompiled version keeps being served.

After looking into evicting the ContentProviderManager cache on classpath change, I came to realize this whole caching strategy implementation was a mistake in the 1st place. Caching is good for slow decompilers, BUT, caching should be an implementation detail of the IContentProvider. For instance if say the FernDecompiler is slow, it should cache its own entries. Changing `java.contentProvider.preferred` would serve the appropriate content, cached or not, as per each provider implementation.

So, I plan on removing Cache<String, String> cachedContent from ContentProviderManager, and deprecating cacheable from https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/0a792b21042c121499d6052a93346c348e95c475/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/schema/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core.contentProvider.exsd#L83

Eventually, each provider will be responsible for caching their results, should it be necessary.

cc @dgileadi

issues.title: SearchEngine#searchAllTypeNames is too slow on big projects
issues.body:
We use `SearchEngine#searchAllTypeNames` in Che's debugger and when try to debug Che from Che it works too slow. Response could come a minute later. We did profiling and it turned out that the bottleneck is in underlying JDT SearchEngine.
Here is profiling results:
![prof](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15607393/34378808-90556d46-eb00-11e7-8295-84c1dea77842.png)

From the results:
- method `org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModel#getTarget(IPath, boolean)` is called about 4,500,000 times
 - method `org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager#performCurrentJob(IJob, IProjressMonitor)` has long execution time.

issues.title: Documentation not included in completion resolve since PR 425
issues.body:
Opening an issue as requested.

We're upgrading ycmd to use v0.10.0 and investigating a few test failures.

Currently hitting the issue described here: https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/pull/425#issuecomment-354180298

In short, prior to PR #425, the resolve completion returned `documentation` as expected. As of that PR, it no longer does for that specific test case.

In VSCode, however, it _does_ have the documentation when selecting the entry, so it's possible some difference in the sequence of messages my client sends.

The full sequence of messages (both before and after) are in this gist: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2329af7bff6bc5a6cfc51dfbddcd27b5 and the file in question is here: https://github.com/puremourning/ycmd-1/blob/java-language-server/ycmd/tests/java/testdata/simple_eclipse_project/src/com/youcompleteme/Test.java

I would provide steps to repro, but unfortunately it doesn't happen in VScode, so that's tricky. It can be reproduced in Vim using YouCompleteMe, but that would just produce the gist'd messages.

```java
module org.java9.test {
```

issues.title: pom.xml diagnostics don't recognize unsupported tags
issues.body:
jdt.ls doesn't report any issues if unsupported tag is used;

```
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.google.inject</groupId>
            <artifactId>guice</artifactId>
            <unsupported-tag>value</unsupported-tag>
        </dependency>
```

issues.title: BundleUtilsTest tests sometimes fail
issues.body:
The issue happens because OSGi updates the equinox registry asynchronously.
If getBundleExtensionResult() is called before than OSGi updates the equinox registry, OSGi won't find an extension point and a test will fail.

issues.title: Server embeds both guava 15 and 21
issues.body: Only guava 21 was present in jdt.ls 0.4.0, then guava 15 creeped in 0.5.0

issues.title: completion request should include textEdit according to protocol

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Compute TextEdits during textDocument/completion call

TextEdits need to be computed during the completion call, but this can be extremely slow
when a large number of results is returned. This change tries to mitigate the issue by returning
a partial result list and marking the results as incomplete. Smaller payload means computing
Textedits is now more affordable.
Hopefully the UX should be improved as well since completion queries will return faster too.
The number of completion results is configurable with the java.completion.maxResults preference
(defaults to 50).
Setting 0 will disable the limit and return all results. Be aware the performance will be very
negatively impacted as textEdits for all results will be computed eagerly (can be thousands of results).

Fixes #465

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
The current version of the protocol contains the [following text](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#completion-request):

> However, properties that are needed for the inital sorting and filtering, like sortText, filterText, insertText, and textEdit must be provided in the textDocument/completion request and must not be changed during resolve.

However jdt.ls returns only `insertText` in the original response, but then adds a `textEdit` after a resolve. This is a strict violation of the protocol and in editors that can't handle the resolve request properly, requires either that we resolve every completion item (the use of textEdit is not optional, [insertion text alone doesn't work for things like imports](https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/issues/353)).

Is it possible to include the `textEdit` in the initial response?

issues.title: Errors reported for java files belonging to a non default project, but not on its classpath
issues.body:
Following up on #453, when a java file belongs to a project, but is not in an actual source folder, compilation errors should be ignored. 
Because it already belongs to a project, it's probably not a good idea to link it to the default project either. Which means that file should not receive any java support whatsoever.

issues.title: BundleActivator.start called twice from the extension bundle
issues.body:
With the change in the BundleUtils' start method without Bundle.START_ACTIVATION_POLICY in 
```java 
         bundle.start()
```
The debugger plugin start called twice
1. First one on the BundleUtil
2. Second one on the DelegateCommandHandlerDescriptor

Is this the design behavior for BundleActivator.start? Should we avoid this multiple issue on the start or with Bundle.START_ACTIVATION_POLICY? 

@gorkem @fbricon

issues.title: SymbolKind.Function returned for Method
issues.body:
The method DocumentSymbolHandler#mapKind() returns "SymbolKind.Function" when for a Java method.
My expectation is that it would return SymbolKind.Method.

issues.title: jdt.ls distro should not contain pack.gz files

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Exclude pack.gz files from distro. Fixes #419

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body: Distributions from http://download.eclipse.org/jdtls/snapshots/?d are ~42MB, but contain about 7.8MB of unnecessary pack.gz files

issues.title: sha256 files missing from the download area
issues.body:
sha256 files have not been generated since the 24/10/2017

See http://download.eclipse.org/jdtls/snapshots/?d

issues.title: InitializeParams#rootPath is ignored

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Restore InitializeParams.rootPath support

fixes #402

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
According to [Language Server Protocol 3.0](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/3.0.0/protocol.md#initialize) InitializeParams contains both a `rootPath` (though deprecated) and `rootUri` (preferred). Both of these are supported [in LSP4J](https://github.com/eclipse/lsp4j/blob/3c309e0fe63056bb8146c104774c0ebb2112cb58/org.eclipse.lsp4j/src/main/xtend-gen/org/eclipse/lsp4j/InitializeParams.java#L77).

In pre-0.1.0 versions of eclipse.jdt.ls, both `getRootPath` and `getRootUri` were checked (see [this commit](https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/commit/277ee177090843c0b2560e779d3bff3af9dd9ce5#diff-77a4e07ecb50e4529272a8d107e6c143) for when this changed).

This presents as an issue in Atom where ide-java, relying on atom-languageclient, is sending initialize calls with a `rootPath` only. I'm opening a ticket with them to resolve this, but having eclipse.jdt.ls support both `getRootPath` and `getRootUri` would comply better with the spec.

See atom/ide-java#37 for resulting error.

issues.title: Code action sends invalid WorkspaceEdit
issues.body:
From a Mattermost conversation:

tsmaeder
@fbricon I think the TextDocumentEdit I get from a code action are not according to spec:
I add a field "private int foo;" to a class.
then I do the code action "create getter and setter for 'foo'"
I get a list of edits that insert text at the exact same range. 
However, I believe according to https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#new-textdocumentedit, this is not correct.
The edits "must be non-overlapping".
Because the creator of the edit list "doesn't need to sort the array or do any kind of ordering", I cannot rely on the ordering in the list to determine which to apply first.
	
fbricon
@tsmaeder I think edits are sent ordered, so that you don't have to do any sort
@aeschli any opinion on ^^?

tsmaeder
Yes, the edits work fine if you're applying them in reverse order of arrival, but that's just a lucky accident.

tsmaeder
also: "If multiple TextEdits are applied to a text document, all text edits describe changes made to the initial document version. Execution-wise text edits should be applied from the bottom to the top of the text document. Overlapping text edits are not supported."
This implies that i need to be able to sort the text edits from bottom to top, which implies that the ranges must be distinct and non-overlapping.

gercan
@tsmaeder Can you even sort them on the client if they are changes made to the initial document version? In the example you have above they look like overlapping because they need to be applied one after the other. I think what JDT LS is doing wrong is it is not merging TextEdits
Fri, Oct 20, 2017

tsmaeder
@gercan the spec says that server does not have to sort the edits in any way. That means the client has to have a different way to determine in which order to apply the edits. This implies that the "non-overlapping" in the spec also means that the ranges of any two edits must not have the same start position (which is the case with the edits from jdt). 
I can trivially apply the edits in reverse order of the list, but that might be the exact wrong thing for another language server, and I could not tell the implementer of that LS that his LS is wrong.

issues.title: Standalone java files's CompilationUnits are not WorkingCopies in Mac

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Use *real* URI to find resources

Fixes #388

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body: On Mac, after saving a standalone java file, the CompilationUnit is not a working copy, this causes the fix in #356 to fail. This is caused by JDTUtils.resolveCompilationUnit always creating a new Fake CompilationUnit on every call. Why? because ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot().findFilesForLocationURI(uri) keeps returning null. Why? Because, on case-insensitive Mac,down the line the linked resources are stored by workspace.getAliasManager() using the "real" path as a key: instead of using `/Users/fbricon/foo/Bar.java`, the linked resource is referenced by  `/USERS/fbricon/foo/Bar.java`, making the lookup fail *every* time.

issues.title: InitializationParams.processId is optional (JDT-LS crashes)
issues.body:
LSP spec says processId in InitializationRequest can be null: https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#initialize-request
However, JDT-LS doesn't support null processId and fails at init: https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/523506989caaf0445678aec3cad725e112baad96/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/InitHandler.java#L87

issues.title: Flush ContentProviderManager cache when java.contentprovider.preferred changes
issues.body:
Following https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/pull/360#issuecomment-336322051

We probably need to introduce a sort of preference listener, to notify the ContentProviderManager that it needs to flush its cache, upon ` java.contentprovider.preferred` changes.

cc @dgileadi

issues.title: Investigate high CPU usage on Windows, due to parentProcessStillRunning()
issues.body:
From https://gitter.im/Microsoft/vscode-java-debug?at=59d57a4101110b72317a3bca :
```
The issue is that the Redhat extension runs java.exe (eclipse_1624.dll), which continually 
runs cmd.exe, which runs  tasklist.exe and findstr.exe.  This causes high CPU usage.
```

As @andxu correctly points out, the jdt plugin: 
```
will check task list periodically to find the process which starts it to keep the same
 life-cycle with it, the code is at 
```
https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/98e1e50452d332ba2bbf9050ac1b23f6051ab5ea/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/LanguageServer.java#L53-L57

and
https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/98e1e50452d332ba2bbf9050ac1b23f6051ab5ea/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/LanguageServer.java#L28

issues.title: jdt.ls should not exit on 'shutdown' request
issues.body:
LSP has a request and a notification for shutting down:

- client requests "shutdown", server responds
- client _notifies_ "exit", server exits

I don't really know why this separation exists, but it is in the protocol: https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#shutdown-request

In my testing, it appears that jdt.ls exits when receiving the `shutdown` request. The result is that the client never receives a response to this "request".

https://gist.github.com/puremourning/1258c573b11cb3c19c55dfa7c109e4d0

*What I did:* Sent a shutdown request
*What I expected to happen:* The server should respond to the shutdown request, and stay running until receiving the "exit" notification (which does not require a response)
*What actually happens:* The server exits when handling the shutdown request.

For now I have worked around this in my client implementation, so it isn't urgent.

issues.title: Shutdown invalid JSON when using stdio

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Remove logs to stdio

fixes #347

Signed-off-by: Gorkem Ercan <gorkem.ercan@gmail.com>

issues.body:
When executing the shutdown request over stdio the response is invalid because the shutting down method writes plain text logging to stdout here https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/LanguageServer.java#L75

e.g.
 ```
Shutting down language server
Content-Length: 38

{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":"5","result":{}}
```

I'd recommend either removing that or making it only display that when not running in stdio mode.

issues.title: NPE when using ClientCapababilities in initialize

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Add null checks in ClientPreferences. Fixes #334

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
All fields in the ClientCapabilities structure are optional (recursively). LSP4J maps this to null values. Sending a initialize message with some of the fields omitted leads to a NPE in InitHandler#initialize(...)
Since the protocol specifies that the fields are optional, initialize fails for correct messages according to spec.

issues.title: When CodeLens is disabled, capability should be unregistered

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Dynamically (un)register textDocument/codeLens capability

Fixes #287

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
currently, when codelens is disabled, the capability is still registered, which means clients still try to send codelens queries to the server.
We should leverage dynamic capability registration when available

issues.title: didChange without optional range

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
didChange add support for optional range (#299)

Fixes #286 

Signed-off-by: Amiram Wingarten <amiramw@gmail.com>

issues.body:
According the https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#textDocument_didChange the didChange can be sent without range so that the whole file content is replaced.
This does not seem to work with jdt.ls... 
It doesn't matter if we send start and end null or if we don't sent it at all. We get the same behavior.
Is it a bug or something we miss?

issues.title: Code actions modifying other files don't update current file diagnostics
BadLocationExceptions cause Diagnostic with invalid ranges to be returned

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Don't return invalid Range in WorkspaceDiagnosticsHandler.convertRange

Fixes #270

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
When I test the LSP support in Orion, sometimes I will get a BadLocationException logged. This might be due to a timing or synchronization issue on our end but we end up getting an invalid range in the JSON response from the server. This is because the `Range` object is being [instantiated without any positions set](https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/c552bc60a29e563b05ab3c9d73ea98b4bda56837/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/WorkspaceDiagnosticsHandler.java#L162-L167).

Would it be possible to change the code to provide an actual valid range (even if it both starts and ends are set to offset 0)?


issues.title: Wrong URI set for diagnostics of standalone java files

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Ensure standalone files are always linked

Fixes #268

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
When opening a standalone java file, we 1st link it to the default Java project in JDTUtils.getFakeCompilationUnit. The link is performed in a workspace job, but JDTUtils.getFakeCompilationUnit is already called within a IWorkspaceRunnable, in DocumentLifeCycleHandler.didOpen. 
So by the time JDTUtils.getFakeCompilationUnit returns, the resource has not been actually linked yet, because the linking job hasn't run, which causes diagnostics to return the uri of the linked resource, not the one from the actual file

Handle CompletableFutures more consistently across the board

Fixes #243
Fixes #240

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
From vscode-java, while trying to autocomplete while the server is still starting: 
```
[Error - 10:55:15 AM] 29-May-2017 10:55:11 AM Problem with codeComplete for file:///Users/fbricon/Dev/souk/vertx-game-server/src/main/java/Foo.java
null

	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.performConcurrentJob(JobManager.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.BasicSearchEngine.searchAllTypeNames(BasicSearchEngine.java:1816)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.SearchableEnvironment.findTypes(SearchableEnvironment.java:432)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.codeassist.CompletionEngine.findTypesAndPackages(CompletionEngine.java:10832)

	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Openable.codeComplete(Openable.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.CompilationUnit.codeComplete(CompilationUnit.java:357)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.CompilationUnit.codeComplete(CompilationUnit.java:345)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core.internal.handlers.CompletionHandler.computeContentAssist(CompletionHandler.java:79)
```

I think there's no need to propagate OperationCanceledException all the way up. It could be caught and CompletionHandler.computeContentAssist could just return an empty collection.

This raises the issue of how to deal with cancelled monitors in general. Who should be responsible for dealing with them? @gorkem?

Setting the Target Platform to 'Java Language Server Target Definition' solved the problem.
Would be great if you could add it to the instructions.

issues.title: CompletionItem.documentation, detail should be plain text
issues.body:
Follow up on https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/215
The server protocol declares [CompletionItem's](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/versions/protocol-2-x.md#textDocument_completion) documentation and detail attributes should be plain text.

I believe we should, instead of returning markdown'ed javadoc, use JSoup's [HtmlToPlainText](https://jsoup.org/apidocs/index.html?org/jsoup/examples/HtmlToPlainText.html) to return plain text from the html javadoc

issues.title: Connection over stdin/stdout breaks sometimes
issues.body: The server does not work reliable when I use stdin and stdout as a transport. It seems that there are some logging to stdout is going on, e.g. from lsp4j, that breaks communication.

issues.title: Opening a single java file fails to initialize the language server

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Set workspace location as rootPath, when rootPath missing from init. Fixes #194

issues.title: Projects are no longer imported

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Properly handle InitializeParams.getRootUri(). Fixes #191

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body: Projects are no longer imported because, in InitHandler, InitializeParams.getRootUri() is no longer null and is used as-is to compute the root project path (as in new File("file:///path/to//folder"));

issues.title: Saving a file doesn't update compilation errors on dependent classes

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Refresh saved java files to update compilation errors in the workspace. Fixes #187

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body: If you have 2 Files A and B, B calling A.foo(), breaking foo() in A.java and saving the file should trigger an error in B. It's not the case because A.java is not refreshed upon saving externally.

issues.title: Log handler converts >> into unicode characters
issues.body:
I noticed this weird log message using the java lsp server inside Orion:

`{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"window/logMessage","params":{"type":3,"message":"2017-01-17 11:16:22 \u003e\u003e document/completion"}}
`

As you can see '>' has been replaced with \u003e. This should not be the case. I need to investigate where this conversion occurs.

issues.title: WorkspaceDiagnosticsHandler generate bogus ranges from error markers

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Properly convert IMarkers to Diagnostics. Fixes #107

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
When workspace errors are reported through WorkspaceDiagnosticsHandler, incorrect ranges are sent to the client.

This is caused by calculating the ranges from IMarker.CHAR_START and IMarker.CHAR_END, which are offsets from the start of the document, not from the line.

issues.title: Server fails to start 95% of the time when started with the -noverify flag

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix #81 ensure connection starts only after the LanguageServer is set

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
So the server fails to start 95% of the time when started with the -noverify flag, and rarely succeeds, which smells like a race condition.

After some tracing, I found that, when the server is started the following happens:
- LanguageServer application is accessed on main thread
- it triggers JavaLanguageServerPlugin start(), which starts the JavaClientConnection which spawns some other Thread(s)
- the Initialization handler is called before above start() ends from an LSP Thread, which NPEs on JavaLanguageServerPlugin.getLanguageServer().setParentProcessId(...); because the language server hasn't been set
- JavaLanguageServerPlugin start() has finished, the LanguageServer is set on JavaLanguageServerPlugin the main thread. Too late.

issues.title: Documentation not included in completion resolve since PR 425
issues.body:
Opening an issue as requested.

We're upgrading ycmd to use v0.10.0 and investigating a few test failures.

Currently hitting the issue described here: https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/pull/425#issuecomment-354180298

In short, prior to PR #425, the resolve completion returned `documentation` as expected. As of that PR, it no longer does for that specific test case.

In VSCode, however, it _does_ have the documentation when selecting the entry, so it's possible some difference in the sequence of messages my client sends.

The full sequence of messages (both before and after) are in this gist: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2329af7bff6bc5a6cfc51dfbddcd27b5 and the file in question is here: https://github.com/puremourning/ycmd-1/blob/java-language-server/ycmd/tests/java/testdata/simple_eclipse_project/src/com/youcompleteme/Test.java

I would provide steps to repro, but unfortunately it doesn't happen in VScode, so that's tricky. It can be reproduced in Vim using YouCompleteMe, but that would just produce the gist'd messages.

issues.title: Server embeds both guava 15 and 21
issues.body: Only guava 21 was present in jdt.ls 0.4.0, then guava 15 creeped in 0.5.0

issues.title: [regression] OperationCanceledExceptions littering the logs on `document/codeLens`

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Don't log OperationCanceledException during 'document/codeLens'. Fixes #316

Signed-off-by: Fred Bricon <fbricon@gmail.com>

issues.body:
Cancelled queries to `document/codeLens` fill the logs with OperationCanceledExceptions. This should be ignored instead. This is a side effect of #306.

```
[Info  - 11:33:05 AM] 31-Jul-2017 11:32:05 AM >> document/codeLens

null
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException
```
